sec.title: June 5-8, 2013
sec.p: “Coupling Today: Love, Parenting, Community. Systemic Practices With Couples and Families in Their Social Contexts,” 35th Annual Meeting and 2nd Open Conference of the American Family Therapy Academy (cosponsored by Ackerman Institute for the Family), Chicago, Illinois. Call for abstracts/Deadline for submission: October 31, 2012. Contact: American Family Therapy Academy: (1608 20th Street, NW, 4th Floor,Washington, DC 20009; Phone: 202-483-8001; Fax: 202-483-8002; Email: afta@afta.org; Website: http://www.afta.org/2013).

sec.title: June 19-22, 2013
sec.p: “Honoring the Past, Celebrating the Future,” 11th International Family Nursing Conference, Hyatt Regency Minneapolis, Minnesota. This conference will be the official meeting of the International Family Nursing Association. Call for papers will open in October 2012. Contact: International Family Nursing Association (461 Cochran Road, Box #246 Pittsburgh, PA; telephone: 412-344-1414; fax: 412-344-0599; email: debbie@internationalfamilynursing.org; website: http://www.internationalfamilynursing.org).

sec.title: September 5-6, 2013
sec.p: Final Project Conference, Family Health Nursing in European Communities, hosted by Escola Superior de Enfermagem Do Porto, Portugal. Official conference language: English. This conference marks the end of a 2-year European funded project that takes forward World Health Organization (WHO; Europe) research that called for a new health care model to meet the changing health needs of our population. The conference may be of interest to health care professionals, students, researchers, and nurse educators with an interest in family health, family nursing, community nursing and related areas. For more information and registration see: http://www.uws.ac.uk/familyhealthnursingconference2013/

sec.title: September 23-26, 2013
sec.p: “Advanced Family Nursing Externship,” 4-day workshop with Lorraine M. Wright, RN, PhD (http://www.lorrainewright.com) and Janice M. Bell, RN, PhD (http://www.janicembell.com) will provide specific ideas for compassionate, competent, and confident care of patients and their families in a variety of nursing contexts. Two advanced practice models will be highlighted including the Illness Beliefs Model (http://www.illnessbeliefsmodel.com) and the Trinity Model (http://www.spiritualitysufferingandillness.com). Sponsored by the Research Unit of Nursing, Faculty of Health Sciences and University College of Lillebaet, University of Southern Denmark, Odense, Denmark. For information and registration: http://www.sdu.dk/Om_SDU/Institutter_centre/Klinisk_institut/Forskning/Forskningsenheder/Sygeplejeforskning/Nyheder/Externshipsep13 Contact: Dr. Birte Østergaard: boestergaard@health.sdu.dk

sec.title: October 10-12, 2013
sec.p: “Disrupting Status Quo,” 15th Annual Conference, Collaborative Family Healthcare Association, Omni Interlocken Resort, Denver, Colorado: http://www.cfha.net/?2013Denver. Proposals accepted online February 1 to March 15, 2013. Contact: Collaborative Family Healthcare Association (P.O. Box 23980, Rochester, NY, USA 14692-3980; Email: info@CFHA.net; Website: http://www.cfha.net)

sec.title: October 17-20, 2013
sec.p: “Raising Vibrant Children,” American Association for Marriage and Family Therapy, 71th Annual Conference, Portland, Oregon: http://www.aamft.org/iMIS15/AAMFT/Education_and_Training/Annual_Conference/Content/Events/Annual_Conference.aspx?hkey=01376fe8-c4e8-439f-a51b-8418d371323f. Deadline for on-line submission of abstracts: December 21, 2012. Contact: American Association for Marriage and Family Therapy (112 South Alfred Street, Alexandria, VA 22314-3061; telephone: 703-838-9808; Fax: 703-838-9805; email: ccentral@aamft.org; website: www.aamft.org).

sec.title: November 6-9, 2013
sec.p: “Well-being of Children and Youth in Families and Communities,” National Council on Family Relations, 75th Annual Conference, Grand Hyatt San Antonio, Texas. Deadline for conference proposal submission is Friday, March 1, 2013. Contact: National Council on Family Relations (1201 West River Parkway, Suite 200, Minneapolis, MN 55454; telephone: 888-781-9331; e-mail: ncfr@aol.com; website: http://www.ncfr.org/).

sec.title: November 14, 2013
sec.p: “Nursing Explorations 2013, Strengths-Based Nursing: Practice, Education and Leadership,” Ingram School of Nursing, McGill University. Location: Montreal Convention Centre, Montreal, Quebec, Canada. This special event will focus on Dr. Laurie Gottlieb’s revolutionary approach to nursing and the principles, skills, and tools required to integrate Strengths-Based Nursing into everyday clinical practice. Website: http://www.medicine.mcgill.ca/nursing-explorations2013

sec.title: June 24-27, 2014
sec.p: “The Advanced Practice of Caring for Families,” 4-day workshop with Lorraine M. Wright, RN, PhD (http://www.lorrainewright.com) and Janice M. Bell, RN, PhD (http://www.janicembell.com) will provide specific ideas for compassionate, competent, and confident care of patients and their families in a variety of nursing contexts. Two advanced practice models will be highlighted including the Illness Beliefs Model (http://www.illnessbeliefsmodel.com) and the Trinity Model (http://www.spiritualitysufferingandillness.com). Sponsored by Zurich University of Applied Sciences, School of Health Professions, Institute of Nursing, Winterthur, Switzerland. For information contact: Barbara Preusse-Bleuler, RN, MNS, Email: preu@zhaw.ch

sec.title: November 18-22, 2014
sec.p: National Council on Family Relations, 76th Annual Conference, Hilton Baltimore, Baltimore, Maryland. Contact: National Council on Family Relations (1201 West River Parkway, Suite 200, Minneapolis, MN 55454; telephone: 888-781-9331; e-mail: ncfr@aol.com; website: http://www.ncfr.org/).

sec.title: November 10-14, 2015
sec.p: National Council on Family Relations, 77th Annual Conference, Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. Contact: National Council on Family Relations (1201 West River Parkway, Suite 200, Minneapolis, MN 55454; telephone: 888-781-9331; e-mail: ncfr@aol.com; website: http://www.ncfr.org/).
